channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Rubio warns of U.S. action if Panama does not curb Chinese influence around the canal
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio threatened unspecified action if Panama does not take steps to lessen Chinese influence over the Panama Canal.
item.content:encoded:
Secretary of State Marco Rubio threatened unspecified action if Panama does not take steps to lessen Chinese influence over the Panama Canal.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Amid high-stakes U.S. diplomatic visit, Panamanians turn to news parodies
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio is in Panama to discuss the Canal. Amid this high-profile visit, Panamanians have been turning to El Gallinazo, an account that posts satirical takes on the news.
item.content:encoded: Secretary of State Marco Rubio is in Panama to discuss the Canal. Amid this high-profile visit, Panamanians have been turning to El Gallinazo, an account that posts satirical takes on the news.
item.dc:creator: Ari Shapiro

item.title: Trump used fentanyl to justify tariffs, but the crisis was already easing
item.description: The White House says fentanyl smuggled to the U.S. justifies tariffs against Canada, China and Mexico. But fentanyl deaths and smuggling have been dropping fast — and Canada plays almost no role.
item.content:encoded:
The White House says fentanyl smuggled to the U.S. justifies tariffs against Canada, China and Mexico. But fentanyl deaths and smuggling have been dropping fast — and Canada plays almost no role.

(Image credit: Rebecca Noble)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: A plane and a tug vehicle collide at Chicago's O'Hare airport, injuring the driver
item.description: The 64-year-old tug driver sustained head and lower body injuries and was transported to the hospital in critical condition but was later stabilized, Chicago police said.
item.content:encoded:
The 64-year-old tug driver sustained head and lower body injuries and was transported to the hospital in critical condition but was later stabilized, Chicago police said.

(Image credit: Kiichiro Sato)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Why does Musk want USAID 'to die'? And why did its website disappear?
item.description: Under the Trump administration, the U.S. agency that funds aid projects has faced layoffs, a stop action order for most aid efforts and a disruption of its website. Now Elon Musk says it should 'die.'
item.content:encoded:
Under the Trump administration, the U.S. agency that funds aid projects has faced layoffs, a stop action order for most aid efforts and a disruption of its website. Now Elon Musk says it should 'die.'

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Melody Schreiber

item.title: Your ears can't prick up, but your ear muscles sure try
item.description: Humans actually have vestigial muscles that activate when listening closely to something, even though people lost the ability to really move their ears about 25 million years ago.
item.content:encoded:
Humans actually have vestigial muscles that activate when listening closely to something, even though people lost the ability to really move their ears about 25 million years ago.

(Image credit: ChristopherBernard/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: In the LA fires and the NC floods, 'CPR for mental health' treats unseen wounds
item.description: From Altadena to Asheville, people devastated by recent disasters encountered helpers trained in Psychological First Aid. Like CPR, anybody can learn it.
item.content:encoded:
From Altadena to Asheville, people devastated by recent disasters encountered helpers trained in Psychological First Aid. Like CPR, anybody can learn it.

(Image credit: Ryan Kellman)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Life in Goma, the Congolese city under a new occupation
item.description: A glimpse of life after the siege in the eastern Congolese city of Goma, as some semblance of a tenuous peace returns, as does the fear of reprisals.
item.content:encoded: A glimpse of life after the siege in the eastern Congolese city of Goma, as some semblance of a tenuous peace returns, as does the fear of reprisals.
item.dc:creator: Emmet Livingstone

item.title: What it's like to party in the native habitat of Groundhog Day star Punxsutawney Phil
item.description: It was a big party in Punxsutawney this weekend. "This is my favorite holiday," one local says of the fuss-free day, adding, "You don't have to even see your in-laws." This year, Phil saw his shadow.
item.content:encoded: It was a big party in Punxsutawney this weekend. "This is my favorite holiday," one local says of the fuss-free day, adding, "You don't have to even see your in-laws." This year, Phil saw his shadow.
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Astronomers are tracking an asteroid that could hit Earth in 2032
item.description: The odds are about 1% that the football field-sized object could hit the Earth, but that makes it the closest call in more than 20 years.
item.content:encoded:
The odds are about 1% that the football field-sized object could hit the Earth, but that makes it the closest call in more than 20 years.

(Image credit: Sergey Hametov)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman
